page.title: 19PEOPLE & FARMING-W.WRATTING
page.content: The major land use in the whole of the survey area is arable farming, but modern methods mean that very few people are employed in farming. Old tied cottages have been sold or let in many cases. Not much activity can be seen in the fields except at harvest time. The farming has an important influence on the environment in which the local people live. There is very little common land or accessible wood- land and many footpaths are ploughed over particularly where hedges have been removed to increase field size. This means that there is not much access for adults or children to the land that lies around their homes. Spraying of herbicides and fertilisers and stubble burning are all acticities which can have unpleasant effects on the village population.
